intro: Sabatia gentianoides, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking purple to pink flowers that resemble those of the coneflower genus. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
